meanings.definition: Birds, especially domesticated ones, raised for food or feathers.
meanings.sent1: The farmer fed his fowls in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The fowls in the coop clucked happily.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to chase the fowls around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The colorful plumage of the fowls brightened the farm.
meanings.sent5: The children loved watching the fowls pecking at the ground.

meanings.definition: To hunt or pursue game birds.
meanings.sent1: The hunters fowls in the forest for their dinner.
meanings.sent2: He fowls on weekends to relax and enjoy nature.
meanings.sent3: She fowls with great skill, always returning with a catch.
meanings.sent4: The falconer fowls with his majestic bird of prey.
meanings.sent5: Fowling requires patience and precision to be successful.
